page.title: 12The school in Herm.
page.content: Herm has one primary school for all children resident on the island. The school is housed in a building at the top of the hill, and comprises one classroom, with a storage area and toilet. The school caters for children from 4 to 11 years old. Children older than 11 would have to board at a school in Guernsey or on the mainland. At present there are 10 children in the school, 6 boys and 4 girls, ranging in age from 4 to 8 years old. The school is run by the States of Guernsey and provided with equipment and a teacher by them. For many years the teacher had been a resident of Herm,and a door from the school led to a cottage for the teacher, but in 1983 a teacher resident in Guernsey was appointed to Herm, and she travels by boat to Herm each day.
